description: From Middle English asoten, assoten, from Old French asoter.

adjectives.description: assot (comparative more assot, superlative most assot)

examples: Willy, I ween thou be assot.

verbs.description: assot (third-person singular simple present assots, present participle assotting, simple past and past participle assotted or assot)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To besot; to befool; to infatuate.
